summary: The United States-Cuba Trade Act of 2025 aims to lift the trade embargo on Cuba. Key provisions include repealing existing restrictions on trade, travel, and telecommunications, as well as provisions within the Trading with the Enemy Act, the Cuban Democracy Act of 1992, and the Cuban Liberty and Democratic Solidarity (LIBERTAD) Act of 1996. The bill also addresses remittances, nondiscriminatory trade treatment, and negotiations with Cuba.  It grants greater telecommunications access, enables travel freedoms, and mandates a report on US-Cuba trade relations, all with various effective dates.
